content: approximate finished sizes including ears * small 5 x 6 // 10 x 14 cm * medium 6 x 8 // 15 x 21 5 cm * large 7 5 x 10 // 19 x 25 5 cm * x-large 10 x 13 // 25 x 33 cm you will hold two strands of lace weight along with one strand of worsted weight for this project yardage listed accounts for this needles & notions needed * 4 0 mm us 6 circular needles 32 // 80 cm or length preferred for magic loop * craft/pillow stuffing tapestry needle scissors * 2 stitch holders or scrap yarn gauge is not crucial for this project video links/suggestions for cast on magic loop method and embroidery techniques are included this pattern uses judy s magic cast-on which uses the magic loop technique knitting a small circumference with needles on a long cord to begin seamlessly and is written continuing the magic loop method for the body however you can use other preferred methods if you don t wish to continue with magic loop the flat cat is worked in the round and very much like a toe up sock starting with judy s magic cast-on at the bottom and increasing on opposite sides of the work until it s the final width then it s solid stockinette stitch until you reach the body height ears are worked right off of the body with decreases to shape them to a point on each side one at a time after which the top of the head is closed with a kitchener stitch i designed this cat to be a canvas for any embroidered decoration you may want to add be it a face flowers feet or nothing at all the larger sizes are perfect as a small decorative pillow and the small sizes are great for a small toy or accessory while this is not a learn-to-embroider pattern some stitch suggestions and drawings are included to decorate your flat cat
